patterns: Tell me about taking soil sample
What is the technique used to take soil sample
responses: Walk across the field in a 'W' pattern,collect 25 cores with the sampling tool.While using an auger,it should be twisted into the soil to sampling depth and pulled out, carefully transferr it to the bucket.If using a spade, remove a slice of soil about 2.5cm wide to sample depth and collect in a clean bucket.
Dig 6-9 inch deep 'V' shape pit and taking 500gm soil for testing soil

patterns: When can i take soil sample?
When is the best season to take soil sample
responses: All round the year,avoid sampling within two years of applying lime or within two months of applying a compound fertiliser, organic manure or more than 50 kg/ha nitrogen.

Soil samples can be taken at any time of year, but avoid sampling within two years of applying lime or within two months of applying a compound fertiliser, organic manure or more than 50 kg/ha nitrogen.

patterns: What test should i take for soil
What test should I ask for?
Which tests are perfect for soil
responses: pH and lime requirement tests
Extractable phosphorous, potassium and magnesium quoted in milligrams/litre—this quotes the amount of each nutrient available to be used by the plant
There are a wide range of other tests available such as Sulphur, Nitrogen, heavy metals and trace elements as well as soil texture and organic matter.

patterns: Tell me how to control insect in wheat
What are some ways to control insects in wheat
responses: You can use fumigants like methyl bromide and magnesium or aluminium  phosphide

patterns: Give me some information on subsidies

responses: Do you need subsidy value for solar plant, farm pond or pipe line?
Subsidy on farm pond =50% of total cost or 75000/- max
Subsidy on solar plant =70% of total cost
Subsidy on pipe line =60% of total cost

responses: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) is a Central Sector scheme with 100% funding from Government of India. for more details visit pmkisan.gov.in
please visit our website pmkisan.gov.in
i request you to please visit our website pmkisan.gov.in
Under the Scheme an income support of Rs. 6000/- per year is provided to all farmer families across the country in three equal installments of Rs. 2000/- each every four months.
